action.description: Type of registry modification. This can be one of: createkey, writeval, delkey, or delval

actiontype.description: Enum value of the registry modification: 1=createkey, 2=writeval, 4=delkey, 8=delval

cb_server.description: Used to distinguish between multiple EDR servers. Set this in the “server_name” option of cb-event-forwarder.ini.

link_process.description: Deep link to EDR UI for process

link_sensor.description: Deep link to EDR UI for sensor

pid.description: Endpoint OS Process id of process

timestamp.description: Endpoint timestamp of this event since epoch

action.description: Type of file modification: create, write, delete, lastwrite

actiontype.description: Enum value of the file modification: 1=create, 2=write, 4=delete, 8=lastwrite

cb_server.description: Used to distinguish between multiple EDR servers. Set this in the “server_name” option of cb-event-forwarder.ini.

filetype.description: Enum value of the detected file type of this file. Only valid for “lastwrite” actions. See theCbFileType protobuf definitionfor the available values.

filetype_name.description: The detected file type of this file. Only valid for “lastwrite” actions. Currently supported file types: PE, ELF, UniversalBin, Eicar, OfficeLegacy, OfficeOpenXml, PDF, PKZIP, LZH, LZW, RAR, TAR, and 7zip.

link_process.description: Deep link to EDR UI for process

link_sensor.description: Deep link to EDR UI for sensor

pid.description: Endpoint OS Process id of process

timestamp.description: Endpoint timestamp of this event since epoch

cb_server.description: Used to distinguish between multiple EDR servers. Set this in the “server_name” option of cb-event-forwarder.ini.

direction.description: Direction of the netconn event: inbound or outbound

domain.description: The DNS name of the network peer, if available.

ipv4.description: remote ipv4 address of network connection. Maintained for backward compatibility for earlier versions of the event forwarder. See local_ip and remote_ip.

link_process.description: Deep link to EDR UI for process

link_sensor.description: Deep link to EDR UI for sensor

local_ip.description: Local IP address of network connection (network interface on the endpoint)

local_port.description: Local port of the network connection

pid.description: Endpoint OS Process id of process

port.description: remote port of the network connection. Maintained for backward compatibility for earlier versions of the event forwarder. See local_port and remote_port.

remote_ip.description: IP address of the remote system (peer)

remote_port.description: Remote port of the network connection

timestamp.description: Endpoint timestamp of this event since epoch

proxy.description: A boolean field for proxy status

proxy_ip.description: IP address of the web proxy connection

proxy_port.description: Port of the web proxy connection

proxy_domain.description: Domain of the web proxy connection, if available

cb_server.description: Used to distinguish between multiple EDR servers. Set this in the “server_name” option of cb-event-forwarder.ini.

link_process.description: Deep link to EDR UI for process

link_sensor.description: Deep link to EDR UI for sensor

path.description: Path of the module loaded into the current process

pid.description: Endpoint OS Process id of process

timestamp.description: Endpoint timestamp of this event since epoch

cb_server.description: Used to distinguish between multiple EDR servers. Set this in the “server_name” option of cb-event-forwarder.ini.

child_process_guid.description: process guid of the child process

created.description: Specifies whether this process_guid is the child or the parent

link_child.description: Deep link to EDR UI for child process

link_process.description: Deep link to EDR UI for parent process

link_sensor.description: Deep link to EDR UI for sensor

pid.description: Endpoint OS Process id of process

process_guid.description: Cb Process GUID of parent process

timestamp.description: Endpoint timestamp of this event since epoch

cb_server.description: Used to distinguish between multiple EDR servers. Set this in the “server_name” option of cb-event-forwarder.ini.

command_line.description: Command Line of the new process

expect_followon_w_md5.description: If the md5 could not be calculated in time then EDR will send another procstart with the process md5

link_parent.description: Deep link to EDR UI for parent process

link_process.description: Deep link to EDR UI for this process

link_sensor.description: Deep link to EDR UI for sensor

md5.description: MD5 of the executable binary associated with this process

parent_create_time.description: seconds since epoch of parent process create time

parent_path.description: file path of parent’s executable image

parent_process_guid.description: Cb Process GUID of parent process

path.description: file path of the child processes' executable image

pid.description: OS Process id of child process

process_guid.description: Cb Process GUID of child process

timestamp.description: Endpoint timestamp of this event since epoch

username.description: Username used to create child process

logon_type.description: Describes the logon type of the logon session associated with a process. Here value ‘4’ corresponds to ‘Batch’ which indicates that the process is executed on behalf of a user without their direct intervention (possibly a scheduled task). Possible valid values are 0 and 2 to 13 as perhttps://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/cimwin32prov/win32-logonsession.

cb_server.description: Used to distinguish between multiple EDR servers. Set this in the “server_name” option of cb-event-forwarder.ini.

cross_process_type.description: The type of cross process event: either open_process (opening a handle to another process) or open_thread

is_target.description: specifies whether process_guid is the target of the cross process event

link_target.description: Deep link to EDR UI for target process

link_process.description: Deep link to EDR UI for this process

link_sensor.description: Deep link to EDR UI for sensor

pid.description: Endpoint OS Process id of process that generated the crossprocopen event

requested_access.description: Windows bitfield representing the requested access for this process or thread handle (decimal)

target_create_time.description: Target Process create time represented as a 64-bit Windows FILETIME

target_md5.description: md5 of target process executable image

target_path.description: Path of the target process' executable image

target_pid.description: Process ID of the target process

timestamp.description: Endpoint timestamp of this event since epoch

blocked.description: boolean value describing if the action was successfully blocked by EMET

cb_server.description: Used to distinguish between multiple EDR servers. Set this in the “server_name” option of cb-event-forwarder.ini.

emet_timestamp.description: timestamp of EMET event represented by a 64-bit Windows FILETIME

link_process.description: Deep link to EDR UI for process

link_sensor.description: Deep link to EDR UI for sensor

log_id.description: EMET log ID associated with this emetmitigation event

log_message.description: The full log message generated by EMET

mitigation.description: The type of EMET mitigation performed to block the operation. Possible values are Dep, Sehop, Asr, Aslr, NullPage, HeapSpray, MandatoryAslr, Eaf, EafPlus, BottomUpAslr, LoadLibrary, MemoryProtection, SimulateExecFlow, StackPivot, CallerChecks, BannedFunctions, DeepHooks, AntiDetours.

pid.description: Endpoint OS Process id of process that generated the emetmitigation event

timestamp.description: Endpoint timestamp of this event since epoch

blocked_event.description: The type of event that was blocked: either ProcessCreate (the process was terminated immediately upon execution) or RunningProcess (the process was already running on the endpoint when the block was applied).

blocked_reason.description: The reason for block action (Md5Hash is the only possible value)

blocked_result.description: The result of the blocked action: ProcessTerminated, NotTerminatedCBProcess, NotTerminatedSystemProcess, NotTerminatedCriticalSystemProcess, NotTerminatedWhitelistPath, NotTerminatedOpenProcessError, or NotTerminatedTerminateError.

cb_server.description: Used to distinguish between multiple EDR servers. Set this in the “server_name” option of cb-event-forwarder.ini.

command_line.description: Command line associated with the blocked process

path.description: Path of the blocked executable on disk

timestamp.description: Endpoint timestamp of this event since epoch

uid.description: Security Identifier of the username name used for process creation

username.description: Username that initiated the process creation

cb_server.description: Used to distinguish between multiple EDR servers. Set this in the “server_name” option of cb-event-forwarder.ini.

tamper_type.description: The activity which triggered this tamper event: CoreDriverUnloaded, NetworkDriverUnloaded, CbServiceStopped, CbProcessTerminated, or CbCodeInjection

timestamp.description: Endpoint timestamp of this event since epoch

task_name.description: The name of the task that generated the error.

task_type.description: The type of task: “Task” refers to a background task in cb-enterprised; “Job” refers to a cron job.

timestamp.description: The timestamp of the occurence of the error.
